result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Bryant Burger

defendant.name: Burger, Brandon Bryant
defendant.address: 6115 West Lapham Street, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Brandon Bryant Burger.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense's Bail Motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court lowers JusticePoint Supervision to level 3.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.  Case remains calendared for Plea/Sentencing on 11/22/2022 at 2:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Defense's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bail

Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Brandon Bryant Burger.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger appeared by video.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Brandon Bryant Burger.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. *Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Court addressed JusticePoint report.  Court admonished defendant and will have defendant check in with JusticePoint after court.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. Court is in trial on another case and is unable to proceed on this matter. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 35
Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger in court, appear in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Court advised defendant to continue conditions with Justice Point.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with KLD, ALM, ALS, and any other minor children that live at the home of KLD
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Brandon Bryant Burger in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Bryant Burger appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Br. 35. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
